subject: CMU dictionary doesn't merge LOT/THOUGHT
msgSnippet: It was brought to my attention that the CMU dictionary does in fact *not* merge the lexical sets LOT & THOUGHT, as I originally thought. Instead, it merges the
messageBody:
It was brought to my attention that the CMU dictionary does in fact
*not* merge the lexical sets LOT & THOUGHT, as I originally thought.
Instead, it merges the LOT PALM lexical sets.

That means it is much more useful than I originally thought. I need to
simply change all words with "AA" to LOT words, and then go back and
change the true PALM words like "father" back to PALM again.

On the first round, do:

pot P AA1 T => pipe-On-Tut
Father F AA1 DH ER0 => Fife-On-Thither-Ado-Roar

Then on the second round

Father Fife-On-Thither-Ado-Roar => Fife-Ah-Thither-Ado-Roar

The trick is to know the PALM words, but I think I can generate a fairly
good list from another online dictionary.

If I can do this (which I think I can), that should make a lot of the
strange looking words in the news dissapear. Bomb would become
Bob-On-Mime, instead of Bomb-Ah-Mime, as it appears now.

Paul

It was brought to my attention that the CMU dictionary does in fact 
*not* merge the lexical sets LOT & THOUGHT, as I originally thought. 
Instead, it merges the LOT PALM lexical sets.

That means it is much more useful than I originally thought. I need to 
simply change all words with "AA" to LOT words, and then go back and 
change the true PALM words like "father" back to PALM again.

On the first round, do:

pot  P AA1 T => pipe-On-Tut
Father  F AA1 DH ER0 => Fife-On-Thither-Ado-Roar

Then on the second round

Father  Fife-On-Thither-Ado-Roar => Fife-Ah-Thither-Ado-Roar

The trick is to know the PALM words, but I think I can generate a fairly 
good list from another online dictionary.

If I can do this (which I think I can), that should make a lot of the 
strange looking words in the news dissapear. Bomb would become 
Bob-On-Mime, instead of Bomb-Ah-Mime, as it appears now.

Paul
